ohm law: Ohm’s Law states that current is directly proportional to voltage across a conductor at constant temperature. V = I × R.
kirchhoff voltage law: KVL states that the algebraic sum of voltages around any closed loop in a circuit is zero.
kirchhoff current law: KCL states that the total current entering a node is equal to the total current leaving the node.
resistor: A resistor limits current flow and drops voltage. R = ρL/A.
capacitor: Capacitor stores energy as an electric field. C = εA/d.
inductor: Inductor stores energy in magnetic form. V = L (di/dt).
diode: A diode conducts in forward bias and blocks current in reverse bias. Typical drop ~0.7V (Si).
zener diode: Designed to operate in reverse breakdown for voltage regulation.
transistor: A semiconductor device used for amplification or switching.
bjt: A bipolar junction transistor controlled by base current. Three terminals: E, B, C.
mosfet: Metal-Oxide-Semiconductor FET controlled by gate voltage. High switching speed, high input impedance.
amplifier: An amplifier increases amplitude of a signal without changing its shape.
operational amplifier: High gain differential amplifier. Ideal op-amp: infinite gain, infinite input impedance.
rectifier: Circuit that converts AC to DC. Types: half-wave, full-wave, bridge.
filter: Allows certain frequencies and rejects others. LPF, HPF, BPF, BSF.
logic gate: Basic digital circuit performing Boolean operations: AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR, XOR, XNOR.
flip flop: Bi-stable circuit storing 1-bit. Types: SR, JK, D, T.
counter: Sequential circuit used to count pulses. Can be up/down, synchronous/asynchronous.
register: Group of flip-flops storing multiple bits.
microprocessor: A programmable device performing arithmetic and logical operations. CPU only.
microcontroller: Contains CPU, RAM, ROM, I/O ports on a single chip. Used in embedded applications.
modulation: Process of varying a carrier according to message signal for transmission.
amplitude modulation: Carrier amplitude varies with message signal. Equation: s(t)=Ac[1+Ka m(t)]cos(2πfct).
frequency modulation: Frequency of carrier varies with message signal. More noise immune than AM.
phase modulation: Phase of carrier varies with message signal.
demodulation: Extracting baseband information from modulated carrier.
communication system: Collection of devices transferring information from transmitter to receiver.
digital signal: Discrete amplitude and discrete time representing binary values.
signal: Any physical quantity that conveys information.
sampling: Conversion of continuous signal to discrete-time by taking samples at intervals.
nyquist theorem: Sampling frequency must be ≥2×maximum signal frequency.
quantization: Mapping continuous amplitudes into discrete levels.
bandwidth: Frequency range required to transmit a signal effectively.
antenna: Device used to radiate and receive electromagnetic waves.
waveguide: Structure guiding microwave signals with low loss.
radar: Radio detection and ranging, measures distance and velocity of targets.
transformer: Changes AC voltage level using electromagnetic induction. Turns ratio = Vp/Vs = Np/Ns.
eddy current: Circulating currents induced in conductors by changing magnetic fields causing power loss.
hysteresis: Lag between magnetizing force and magnetic flux density, causes hysteresis loss.
communication protocols: Rules governing data exchange. Common: UART, SPI, I2C.
spi: Serial Peripheral Interface, full duplex synchronous serial communication.
i2c: Inter-Integrated Circuit, two-wire serial communication (SDA, SCL).
fourier transform: Converts time-domain signal into frequency components.
laplace transform: Converts differential equations into algebraic equations in s-domain.
adc: Analog to Digital Converter converts analog input into digital binary value.
dac: Digital to Analog Converter converts binary input into analog voltage.
